note.p: Death: His house, Park Crescent, Portland Place, London (02 June 1845)
Education: Privately; school at Greenwich; Caius College, Cambridge. MB (1815), MD (1820)
Career: Censor, Royal College of Physicians (1824); practised in Hackney; Physician, St Luke's Hospital (1829-1945), specialised in care of the mentally ill
References: T Quinn, 'In this issue' in NR 2004 vol 58 pp 245 - 247
E Murphy, 'A mad house transformed: the lives and work of Charles James Beverly FRS (1788-1868) and John Warburton MD FRS (1795-1847)' in NR 2004 vol 58 pp 267 - 281
